sub_title: Senior Manager Technology Projects & Program at Wolters Kluwer
summary:
Expertise in Agile Project Management, People Management, Technology Projects & Programs, Cloud migration & Security, Resource Planning, Data/Business Analysis, Business Intelligence & Process Automation, Vendor Management, Data Warehousing Design, Modelling and ETL along with tools like Salesforce, Teradata, DB2 & SQL server and Jira with over 14 years of work experience in Information Service, Travel, Insurance, Banking, Supply chain domains in multinationals across globe.

Proven skills in assignments and projects issued. Managed multiple projects from end to end, received awards and appreciation, mentored team members & given training on interpersonal & technical skills.

projects.title: The French Beauty Box
projects.description:
The project was about creating an e-commerce platform for a business model. The project started with a business idea of beauty and makeup subscription box having French beauty products for the customer based in China. The project URL will give an idea, how the website might look like if transformed in an actual business. Some key points that were kept in mind while designing the website are:

1. Demographic: Chinese women in middle/high-income level and aged between 18-60 years.
2. Returning Customers: How can u engage your customers so that they become loyal to your brand.

Website Address: http://frenchbeauty.wix.com/beautybox

P.S.: Wix is a free platform to create website hence do not support some features that one would like to have in a live web page.

contributors.headline: Senior Manager Technology Projects & Program at Wolters Kluwer

projects.title: National Customer Cost Tool
projects.description:
Client: US Based Health Insurance Company

Description of the project:  The purpose of this project is to meet all the mandate and fund the work to compile and quality review the required cost range data along with displaying it on the Estimate Your Cost tool. This initiative will automate previous manual processes thereby increasing performance and decreasing dependency on resources.

Role                      	:	Requirement gathering, DWH Designing and Modelling, Team management, Testing  based on given requirement
Responsibility	:	To design the model and test the final product for client
Hardware	:	Intel Based System, Mainframes and DB2 servers
BI Tools	:	Informatica PowerCenter 9.1, MS Office, DB2, Teradata
OS:                   Windows X & Unix

contributors.headline: Senior Manager Technology Projects & Program at Wolters Kluwer

projects.title: Inventory Analytics
projects.description:
Description of the project: An International Beverage Company, which is planning to come up with a product to manage its inventory worldwide on tableau using ETL(Informatica) and SQL Server.

Role                      	:	Requirement gathering and Modelling, DWH Designing, Team management, Testing  
Responsibility	:	To design the model and test the data in facts and source both
Hardware	:	Intel Based System
BI Tools: Informatica PowerCenter 9, Microsoft SQL Server.
Operating System	:	Windows X & Unix

contributors.headline: Senior Manager Technology Projects & Program at Wolters Kluwer

projects.title: DWH Project Phase I
projects.description:
	Leading and Managing an in-house development piece for Pre-ETL activity which is a part of a DWH project in which the data is flowing in from 3 major processes in BSS and is then centralized and restructured in a dimensional model using Informatica & Teradata and reporting through COGNOS
	Helped & supported ETL team in creating the Star Schema for loading DWH based on business facts and knowledge.
	Driven UAT for the design model of Informatica and data validation on Teradata client.
	Validating Reports generated on COGNOS from business perspective.
	With success in Phase I of DWH, senior management has decided to move for Phase II of DWH where in we will be migrating Barclaycard reporting to COGNOS along with ongoing processes.

contributors.headline: Senior Manager Technology Projects & Program at Wolters Kluwer
Senior Data Scientist | Technical Solution Design | Process Improvement | Business & Data Analytics | MSc Supply Chain | Business Administration

profile_positions.description:
Wolters Kluwer (www.wolterskluwer.com) is a global leader in information services and solutions for professionals in the health, tax and accounting, risk and compliance, finance and legal sectors. We help our customers make critical decisions every day by providing expert solutions that combine deep domain knowledge with specialized technology and services. Founded in 1836 and headquartered in Alphen aan den Rijn, the Netherlands, the company serves customers in over 180 countries, maintains operations in over 40 countries and employs 18,600 people worldwide. Wolters Kluwer reported 2018 annual revenues of €4.3 billion.

Core Responsibility: 
- Managing the design and development of the AI enabled expert solutions
- Contributing to existing product enhancement and new product development strategies
- Managing and mentoring other senior project managers in the team
- Responsible for maintaining security of the online products across business unit
- Responsible for BU's first AI/ML project delivery
- SPOC for internal and external technology partner
profile_positions.title: Lead Technology Project and Program Manager

profile_positions.description:
Core Responsibilities: 
- Project managed and delivered first data driven product using machine learning technologies
- Project managed and delivered a custom content enrichment platform for the company
- Managed the data analytics platform for compliance reporting
- Trained business user on the data analytics platform

profile_positions.title: Manager Product Innovation

profile_positions.description:
RATP DEV, a subsidiary of RATP Group (world's fifth largest transport company), operates and maintains urban and interurban transport networks in 15 countries through over 110 subsidiaries.

Since 2014, RATP Dev has developed Hop-on Hop-off sightseeing services with open top double-deckers in the most attractive cities in the world: London, Paris, Berlin, Stockholm, Copenhagen, Riga, Tallinn, Helsinki, Bath, Windsor, Cardiff, Nice, Marseille, Athens and Hong Kong. 

All sightseeing activities worldwide benefit from a commercial and technical shared platform (RDGS plc) based in London. RDGS coordinates, supports and promotes globally the network of sightseeing operations under a single dedicated brand: EXTRAPOLITAN. It’s not just great services that draw customers to our operations, it is the whole EXTRAPOLITAN experience. 

Core Responsibilities: 

- Responsible for Salesforce and Qlik implementation, integration with existing tools, and management for RATP Dev Global Sightseeing 
- Managing the system development & maintenance and IT budget & team 
- Managing and leading all technology service providers for the BU
- Implemented an end-to-end POS solution for street sales (B2C) for Paris operations.
- Responsible for managing and extending the global B2B Portal, "Nexus".
- Overview all the online booking engines on Extrapolitan and Ops API.
- Investigate and integrate new online distribution channels to support the sales effort (affiliation program, market places, Channel Managers etc.)
profile_positions.title: Head of IT

profile_positions.description:
Core Responsibilities:
 
- Managed all online distribution projects for the sightseeing business unit.
- Explored and helped the local supplier like The Original Tour, LOpen Tour and Open Loop NY to improve their online B2B operations.
- Was responsible for Designing and Maintaining the global B2B Portal, "Nexus" for Extrapolitan.
- Exhibited Extrapolitan in the biggest travel shows WTM 2016, WTM 2017 at London and ITB 2017 at Berlin.
- Ran and developed all the online booking engines on API.
- Supported sales team in integrating new B2B clients within company’s API by coordinating with the IT providers.
- In coordination with the sales team, handled the online product database for all sales channels.
- Investigated and integrated new online distribution channels to support the sales effort (affiliation program, market places, etc.)
- Overlooked all CMS changes and updates

volunteer_experiences.description: Green is Green is a pivotal part of Wolters Kluwer sustainability framework to benefit the environment. The Green Is Green “Champion Network” is fundamental to the success of the Green Is Green Office Program

Seva Sahyog Act as a bridge between corporate world and small NGOs working for social welfare. While working with them in Pune, I managed a donation drive for providing school bags and stationary to underprivileged children. For the event, I formed my team of 20 volunteers and carried out the entire donation drive for 2 months and ended up raising a fund of 1.3 Million INR for this cause.
provided educational help to kids coming from low financial background.
participated in world diversity day at Infosys Pune office.
